intro: Koeleria albovii var. glabriculmis, commonly known as the smoothleaf tufted grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Poaceae family, characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, pale blue to white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine or arid environments. Due to its delicate structure and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
